content.description: This route is on great clean white rock. It takes a directed line up the longest section of rock.The first pitch is easy fifth class. The second pitch is what you came for. About 1/3 of the way up, it crosses a old line with 1/4" bolts but continues straight up the face on 3/8" bolts. It's the first line we climbed on Kokopelli and called the rock by the same name.
content.protection: Pitch one has 3 bolts and an anchor. Pitch two has 11 bolts and an anchor.
content.location: Start on the right side of the rock just before the right-facing corner. You can get down with a 70mm rope, but knot the ends and downclimb the last 15 feet on easy fifth class climb, or do two rappels from the top anchor.

content.description: Do awesome bouldery moves for the first 5 or so bolts, then it thins out a bit, and traverse right into some more delicate moves. This route is GREAT and nicely bolted.
content.location:
It is left of

Kokopelli

. The bolt line is under a set of solid, large flakes above and traverses left to right under these flakes. There is an old trad line to the left and to the right of this route.
